question.body: Which layer is triggered to produce more cells to form a callus when an area of skin is under mechanical stress?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although the stratum lucidum does form in thicker skin, these cells cannot actively divide.
Incorrect. Stratum spinosum cells are formed by division of cells in a deeper epidermal layer.
Incorrect. This stratum is known for the granules it possesses, but the cells in it cannot divide.
Correct. The stratum basale is the layer of epidermis in which cells can divide into new cells.
